p: The study based on the essential oil of the species Tithonia diversifolia allowed the determination of antioxidant, cytotoxic and antimicrobial activities. The main compounds found in the essential oils of this study were α-pinene (9.9%), Limonene (5.40%), (Z)- β-ocimene (4.02%), p-cymen-8-ol (3.0%), Piperitone (11.72%), (E)-nerolidol (3.78%) and Spathulenol (10.8%). The antioxidant activity proves that the essential oil of this species has antioxidant action, through the DPPH radical capture method, with IC 50 of 4.30. Its toxicity was elevated with LC 50 of 3.11 μg·mL −1. For the antimicrobial activity, the samples presented promising results against the bacteria S. aureus, E. coli and P. aeruginosa with inhibition of bacterial growth.
